intro: Trivalvaria argentea, commonly known as the silverleaf waterwheel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in wet, boggy environments and is often found near water sources. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
